title: Space in wrapped line marked as duplicated
body:
Issue Type: Bug Set `"editor.renderWhitespace": "boundary"` in settings. Or `"editor.renderWhitespace": "selection"`. Set word wrap. Open a markdown file. Take any long line that wraps with only one space between words. Add characters at the beginning of line till a space appears at the beginning of the wrapped line. Note the character is marked as duplicated (centered pale dot). This is incorrect because it is not a duplicated space. title: Allow extensions control dimensions for existing terminals

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Live Share has a feature where when a user starts a collaboration session as a host, all existing terminals are automatically shared. When other guests join, they'll see these shared terminals. 

The problem is that guests' UI dimensions are different from the host, and such shared  terminals may not render correctly there.

Live Share already solves this for `Pseudoterminal` that users can create via Live Share viewlet. Live Share uses `onDidOverrideDimensions` and `setDimensions` on `Pseudoterminal`. It needs VSCode support for regular `Terminal` objects.

Existing terminals has read-only `dimensions` property on `Terminal` objects which we can use to get current terminal dimensions (maximum ones I assume), but nothing that we can use to change the dimensions, and no event that would tell us when UI changes and max dimensions change.

So the feature request is to expose `onDidOverrideDimensions` and `setDimensions` equivalent on `Terminal` objects that would allow to:
1. Override current terminal dimensions
2. Get current max dimensions as allowed by UI
3. Know when max dimensions change (say when users resize UI).

cc @lostintangent, @Tyriar

title: CSS Language Server Errors - URI contains an authority component

body: Issue Type: Bug VS Code version: Code 1.37.0 (036a6b1d3ac84e5ca96a17a44e63a87971f8fcc8, 2019-08-08T02:33:50.993Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.18362 ## Steps to Reproduce: 1. Don’t have **Google Chrome** installed. 2. Open a **JavaScript** project workspace. 3. Go to the **Extensions** Views Container. ## Expected behaviour: **Debugger for Chrome** isn’t shown among recommended extensions. Optionally **Debugger for Firefox** is shown instead when **Mozilla Firefox** is installed. ## Actual behaviour: Recommended extensions contain **Debugger for Chrome** (even though it can’t be used because **Google Chrome** isn’t installed). --- Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: **Yes**

title: Add support for CSS @supports selector() function

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
The **CSS Conditional Rules Module Level 4** adds [the `selector()` function to the `@supports` at‑rule](https://drafts.csswg.org/css-conditional-4/#at-supports-ext), which is used to test whether the user agent [supports a new **CSS Selectors** feature](https://drafts.csswg.org/css-conditional-4/#support-definition-ext) (e.g. the `:is(…)` pseudo‑class or multi‑value `:not(…)`).

**Visual Studio Code** should provide syntax highlighting and auto‑completion for this.

title: FIles in $GIT_DIR/info/exclude don't appear as gitignored

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Per [this SO answer](https://stackoverflow.com/a/1753078/1243041) and the [Git documentation](https://git-scm.com/docs/gitignore#_configuration), you can add files to the local `.git/info/exclude` file to ignore them in the same way as if they were added to `.gitignore`, except it will only apply locally. The files matched by this means, however, don't appear as gray in VSCode.

Version: 1.38.0-insider (user setup)

title: macOS Text Selection: shift+left should expand selection

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
- VSCode Version: 1.37.0
- OS Version: macOS Mojave 10.14.6

On macOS, the standard text selection behaviour is to expand the current selection when shift + the left arrow key is pressed:

> Here is the **example** text with 'example' selected (e.g. by double-clicking the text)
> Here is th**e example** text on macOS in most applications after pressing shift + the left arrow key twice.
> Here is the **exampl**e text on macOS in Visual Studio code after the same action.

To be consistent with platform conventions, shift + the left arrow should ideally expand the selection. I believe the current behaviour matches the behaviour on Windows.

If there is already a configuration option that changes this behaviour, then I would suggest that the default on macOS be changed to the standard system behaviour.

and no the recent tab will not work due to the face that the drive letter always changes as this is on a USB. and any `.bat` or `.cmd` script will be blocked my the target PC's. If there is a 3rd party extension the already implements this i will be happy if someone could provide a link

title: Bring the "track changes" feature to VS Code

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Anyone who has worked with Visual Studio is likely familiar with the "track changes" feature, which adds green/yellow bars to the side of the editor, as seen in the attached image.

![TrackChangesIndicators](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36111895/62987162-7bf43e00-be0c-11e9-8fdd-f9ca3d2a9060.png)
Green bars are new lines added and saved since opening the file; yellow bars are unsaved lines.

Unfortunately, this doesn't exist in VS Code.
However, VS Code does have a very similar feature called "gutter indicators" as mentioned in [the documentation](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/versioncontrol#_gutter-indicators) but it only applies if you're using version control, whereas in Visual Studio, the feature works with locally stored projects/solutions as well.

Since the functionality already exists in VS Code (for version control), are there any plans to extend it to also work with local files too, just like in Visual Studio?

title: Return of the swipeToNavigate setting
body:
Apparently the swipe event has been fixed in Electron: https://github.com/electron/electron/pull/19319

Can we have this setting again? It was really useful.

Related: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/57629.

title: Add git Setting: Toggle Commit Message Window

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
There are several settings available related to git commit messages, such as:

* `git.inputValidation`
* `git.InputValidationLength`
* `git.InputValidationSubjectLength`

I don't like to use the Commit message window provided in the Source Control pane in the Activity Bar. I have a `.gitmessage` configured and prefer to use command line/Vim for my commit messages.

Please add a **boolean** setting for the source control panel:

* `git.showCommitWindow`

This setting would allow those of us who prefer to use an editor for commit messages to set this to `false` by default.

Also, the following command would be helpful in the Command Palette:

* `git.toggleCommitWindow` 

It would allow users to toggle the visibility of the commit window.

title: Cursor can sit in between characters and combining diacritics
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

Some combining unicode characters are displayed incorrectly, for example σ̃, which is a valid variable name in e.g. Julia. Sometimes they are displayed by themselves, sometimes combining with the next character instead of the previous one.

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.37.0
- OS Version: MacOS 10.14.5

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a new buffer/document (cmd-n)
2. Enter σ followed by a combining-~ (Alternative 0: copy-paste from right here: σ̃. Alternative 1 (MacOS): ctrl-cmd-space, search for “sigma”, followed by another ctrl-cmd-space, search for “combining tilde”; Alternative 2: for the σ use the Greek keyboard, for the combining tilde follow Alternative 1; Alternative 3: having installed the Julia support packages, switch language to Julia, and type \sigma[tab]\tilde[tab]; Possible (untested) alternative 4: using the Unicode LaTeX package with LaTeX escapes similarly to the Julia package.)
3. Observe that the tilde is incorrectly displayed after the “σ”, not above it.
4. Follow by typing another character, e.g. “a”. 
5. Observe that the tilde is displayed above the “a”, incorrectly.
6. Clear the buffer and repeat steps 2-4 but in place of “σ”, enter “b”, the follow by the combining tilde (copy-paste route: b̃).
7. Observe that the tilde is displayed above the “b”, correctly.


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: Expose terminal scroll position and allow extension change it

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Some of Live Share customers want to follow other participants in shared terminals (https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/live-share/issues/2671). 
One feature that is missing in VSCode is getting and controlling terminal scroll position. Can VSCode expose current scroll position and allow extension changed it in a given pseudo terminal window?

body:
- [x] [Settings GUI] String array: No help in filling enum values #77458
- [x] [Settings GUI] String array: maxItems & minItems ignored #77459
- [ ] Settings UI: When "Add Item" out of view port, have to click 2x #78237 @roblourens 
- [ ] String Settings UI: Multiple edits loses data on Save #78243
- [ ] ~~[Settings GUI] String array: Icons should inherit focused/selected themable colors~~ #78292
